item.title: Ongoing for the last 2 years, 6th January
item.description:
Ongoing issue with all the drains collapsed around our property Highways know about this from our local councillor Stan Smith prestbury but still don’t do anything to rectify Do your job ?????

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Glebe Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Flytipping by Meadow Court near Redwood Estate, 6th January
item.description:
Outside Meadow Court near the entrance to Redwood Estate. In the ditch by the houses. There is furniture dumped in the ditch. It had been left on the pavement for months and has now been dumped into the ditch. It has been like this for several months now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alderton Road, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cut down tree overhanging onto pavement opposite shurdington school, 6th January
item.description:
If highways actually did their job properly and didn’t cut down trees then ram back into the hedge with on lookers this would be great. We pay council tax for on street maintenance not lazy highway people. Tree is sticking out onto pavement, which could result in an accident from a pedestrian or falling into the road if another storm. Right had side of the road, opposite shurdington road primary school
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Lane, Shurdington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Large and deep pothole, 6th January
item.description:
On bend of brookfield road near turn off to Brookfield lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface water constantly present on New Road despite no rain, 6th January
item.description:
Surface water is constantly present on New Road next to the field drainage ditch opposite the entrance to Willow Cottage, and tends to run down the road opposite Ellenborough House and Belclare. This forces cars onto the other side of the road and gives rise to a skidding hazard, especially now that winter has arrived and the water could freeze. This part of the road never used to flood, and presumably is caused due to the drainage ditch having become blocked. This issue has been present for some weeks. Please could it be fixed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Blocked storm drain causing localised flooding during heavy rain storm., 6th January
item.description:
The drain is located at the Ravensgate Road end of the footpath that connects Ravensgate Road to Little Herbert’s Road. The drain is roughly 10m down the path on the left hand side at the point that the path narrows.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strowdes Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding of turning circle, 6th January
item.description:
This is further a report I made in October 2024. We believe the drain that leads off the turning circle is not adequate - there is no grill to prevent debris going down it and as such our turning circle floods almost every time it rains. During the rain 05/01/25 water levels were high enough to almost breach the pavement and come up our drive (283 Priors Road).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 283, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Georges Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Boulders, large stones, silt causing an obstruction, 6th January
item.description:
The gravel build up has amassed over the past few months and each precipitation event causes a further build up. Road markings no longer visible. Dangerous to all road users.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold

item.title: Constant flooding due to broken/blocked drain, 6th January
item.description:
Cowley to Cockleford Road, constant flooding, impassable water depth with a broken drain cover and silted up outflow pipe. Flooding is a daily/weekly occurrence
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley Lane, Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
